snippet: China has played a hidden role in directing the broad outlines of the response to pro-democracy protests, current and former officials from both governments say.
abstract: Interviews with current and former Hong Kong and Chinese government officials reveal that it is China’s national leaders who have been directing broad strokes of response to crisis in Hong Kong; with Beijing’s needs foremost in mind, they have tried to balance a steadfast refusal to give ground on protesters’ demands for democratic elections with need to avoid widespread bloodshed that would further destabilize the city.

byline.original: By KEITH BRADSHER and CHRIS BUCKLEY

lead_paragraph: China has played a hidden role in directing the broad outlines of the response to pro-democracy protests, current and former officials from both governments say.

headline.main: Beijing Is Directing Hong Kong Strategy, Government Insiders Say
headline.print_headline: Beijing Is Directing Hong Kong Strategy, Government Insiders Say
